Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Picturin 1BN (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: norepinephrine-stimulated skin secretion, the Giant Gladiator Treefrog, the Rusty Treefrog,Boana boans, Trinidad, South America

Literature.Author: Conlon JM, Guilhaudis L, Attoub S, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Mechkarska M. 2023
Literature.Title: Purification, Conformational Analysis and Cytotoxic Activities of Host-Defense Peptides from the Giant Gladiator Treefrog Boana boans (Hylidae: Hylinae).

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: isolated chromatographically from pooled skin secretions.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (50.0%) toPicturin-3V=K: 16%; A=T: 12%; GRAVY: 0.328; M Wt: 2679.188; Mol formula: C123H209N31O34; molar extinction coeff: 0.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 12600 (MIC 62.5 uM), Gram- E. coli ATCC 35218 (MIC 7.8 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 49472 (MIC 15.6 uM), and P. aeruginosa ATCC 9072 (MIC 15.6 uM). Also showed cytotoxicity to cancer cells lung adenocarcinoma A549 (LC50 30.7 uM), breast adenocarcinoma MDA-MB-231 cells (LC50 64.2 uM), and colorectal adenocarcinoma HT-29 cells (LC50 84.9 uM).Toxicity: non-neoplastic human umbilical vein endothelial cells HUVEC (LC50 54 uM). This peptide is non-selective.Structure: random coil in water and became helical in the presence of 50% TFE, DPC or SDS micelles.
